```{r setup, include = FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(
  collapse = TRUE,
  comment = "#>"
)

library(goterps)
library(ggplot2)
```


*goterps* is an R package designed for students and faculty at the University of Maryland. It helps create visualizations and presentations aligned with the university's visual identity.


## Installation
To install the development version from GitHub:

```{r, eval=FALSE}
# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("guadag12/goterps")
library(goterps)
```


## Download the Quarto Presentation Template

Use `goterps_presentation()` to download the Quarto presentation files locally:

```{r, eval = FALSE}
goterps_presentation(dest_dir = tempdir())
```

<img src="https://github.com/guadag12/goterps/blob/main/img/quarto_template1.png" width="500" /> <img src="https://github.com/guadag12/goterps/blob/main/img/quarto_template2.png" width="500" />


## Example: Use goterps Theme and Palette with ggplot2

```{r, eval = FALSE}
ggplot(data = iris, aes(x = Sepal.Length, y = Sepal.Width)) +
  geom_point(size = 4) +
  goterps_theme() +
  labs(title = "Scatter Plot of Iris Data",
       x = "Sepal Length",
       y = "Sepal Width")
```

<p align="center">
  <img width="460" height="330" src="https://github.com/guadag12/goterps/blob/main/img/scatter_plain.png">
</p>

## Discrete Color Palette

Use `goterps_palette_d()` for discrete scales:

```{r, eval = FALSE}
ggplot(data = iris, aes(x = Sepal.Length, y = Sepal.Width, color = Species)) +
  geom_point(size = 4) +
  scale_color_manual(values = goterps_palette_d(3)) +
  goterps_theme() +
  labs(title = "Discrete Color Example",
       x = "Sepal Length",
       y = "Sepal Width")
```

<p align="center">
  <img width="460" height="330" src="https://github.com/guadag12/goterps/blob/main/img/scatter1.png">
</p>


## Continuous Color Palette

Use `goterps_palette_c()` for continuous color gradients:

```{r, eval = FALSE}
ggplot(iris[iris$Species == "setosa",], aes(x = Sepal.Width, y = Sepal.Length, color = Sepal.Length)) +
  geom_point(size = 4) +
  scale_color_gradientn(colors = goterps_palette_c(5)) +
  goterps_theme() +
  labs(title = "Continuous Color Example",
       x = "Sepal Width",
       y = "Sepal Length")
```

<p align="center">
  <img width="460" height="330" src="https://github.com/guadag12/goterps/blob/main/img/scales_continuos.png">
</p>
